subject: [Radiance-general] Parallel processing on G5
body:
Fitzsimmons, Rob wrote:

Oh, shut up.  =8-)  So, that's roughly ten times the net cycles per
second my little Powerbook does!  That hertz! (groan)


Well, one nice new thing is that Greg added the -N option to rad in
version 3.6, so that you'll be able to do just what you describe.  In
your case, you'd call rad with -N 2 (for two processors).  It seems
pretty much point-n-shoot, with that option.  Have fun!

-------------------
Rob Guglielmetti
